comment: She is an amazing lady. Her class can be challenging at times and she doesn't lay outh the test answers for you, you have to think for yourself. But she is a really greg professor and really teaches you a lot.

She was patient, clear, very supportive, & intuitively addressed individuals and class needs. Class wasn't too hard or too easy. Read, participate, do the study guides, & practice for recorded interviews. You'll encounter issues in real helping situations-drug use, abuse, etc.  So worth it. I'm changing my major to HS because of her class.

She is a great teacher. Her exams may be a little hard but you will get an A if you study all of your notes. She's the kind of teacher that will make you think about what's going on in the world.You have to do a journal every class which is not that hard. I would recommend everyone to take her class, even if your not a human service major.

She is tough on her grading. She will count your tardies as absences. She gives pop quizzes. Her class was very hard! She even graded harshly on presentations. It was a good class just impossible to get an A.

The material is thought & emotion provoking. Professor Sweat does a good job explaining the material, & I like her choice of text books. She is on top of ATTENDANCE (&tardies) for sure. Her opinion of you is reflected in your grade! She is a good professor OVERALL.
